name: pyridine-compound production | pyridine-compound | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7100/documentation

This dataset represents the production of  pyridine-compunds (1 kg of active ingredient). Raw materials are modelled with a stoichiometric calculation. Energy consumption is modelled with data from a similar process. The emissions are estimated. Infrastructure is included with a default value.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of precursors (acetaldehyde, acetic anhydride, ammonia, 2-butanol, chlorine, formaldehyde, hydrochloric acid, hydrogen fluoride, oxygen, sodium chloride, sodium cyanide, sodium hydroxide, sodium hypochlorite, and water decarbonised) at the factory gate.

This activity ends with pyridine-compunds at the factory gate. The dataset includes the input materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions. The dataset doesn't include emulsives, additives etc.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2021:Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Pyridines are herbicidal compounds with low acute toxicity. They are produced by starting with pyridine or methyl pyridine, which is then halogenated, aminated, or oxidated.;;The dataset pyridine-compounds was calculated from the arithmetic mean of all inputs and outputs of the production of clopyralid, fluroxypyr, and triclopyr.;;Clopyralid is produced in four steps from acetaldehyde:;3 C2H4O + NH3 → C6H7N + 3 H2O + H2;C6H7N + 4 Cl2 → C6H3Cl4N + 4 HCl;C6H3Cl4N + Cl2 → C6H2Cl5N + HCl;C6H2Cl5N + 2 H2O → C6H3Cl2NO2 + 3 HCl;;Fluroxypyr is produced in seven steps from acetaldyhyde:;2 C2H4O + CH2O + NH3 → C5H5N + 3 H2O + H2;C5H5N + NaNH2 + H2O → C5H6N2 + H2 + NaOH;C5H6N2 + 4 Cl2 → C5H2Cl4N2 + 4 HCl;C5H2Cl4N2 + HF → C5H2Cl3FN2 + HCl;C5H2Cl3FN2 + NaOH → C5H3Cl2FN2O + NaCl;C5H3Cl2FN2O + C6H11ClO2 → C11H14Cl2FN2O3 + HCl;C11H14Cl2FN2O3 + H2O → C7H5Cl2FN2O3 + C4H10O;Precursors that are used for the fluroxypyr production are chloro acetic acid butyl ester (C6H11ClO2) and sodium amide (NaNH2). ;Chloro acetic acid butyl ester (C6H11ClO2) is produced in two steps from acetic acid:;C2H4O2 + Cl2 → C2H3ClO2 + HCl;C2H3ClO2 + C4H10O → C6H11ClO2 + H2O;;Sodium amide (NaNH2) is produced in two steps from sodium chloride:;2 NaCl → 2 Na + Cl2;2 Na + 2 NH3 → 2 NaNH2 + H2;;Triclopyr is produced in six steps from acetic acid:;2 C2H4O + CH2O + NH3 → C5H5N + 3 H2O + H2;C5H5N + 5 Cl2 → C5Cl5N + 5 HCl;C5Cl5N + N2H4 → C5H3Cl4N3 + 2 HCl;2 C5H3Cl4N3 + O2 → 2 C5HCl4N + 2 N2 + 2 H2O;3 C5HCl4N + C3H6O3 + 3 NaCN → 3 C7H3Cl3N2O + 3 NaCl;C7H3Cl3N2O + 2 H2O → C7H4Cl3NO3 + NH3;Precursors that are used for the triclopyr production are hydrazine (N2H4) and paraformaldehyde (C3H6O3).;;Hydrazine (C2H3N3) is produced in two steps from sodium hypochlorite:;NaOCl + NH3 → NH2Cl + NaOH;NH2Cl + NaOH + NH3 → N2H4 + NaCl + H2O;;Paraformaldehyde (C3H6O3) is produced from formaldehyde:;3 CH2O → C3H6O3

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Pyridines are herbicides that act as synthetic auxins.

exchanges.description: Estimation, based on the assumption that 0.2% of volatile input materials is emitted to air occurring from the purge vent, the destillation vent and fugitive emission sources.

flow.name: Chlorine
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Estimation, based on the assumption that 0.2% of volatile input materials is emitted to air occurring from the purge vent, the destillation vent and fugitive emission sources. Remaining gases like CH4 or CO are oxidated to CO2. The carbon contained in the removed carbon compounds from wastewater treatment was accounted as CO2 emissions to air (assuming  a removal efficiency of 90%).

flow.name: Carbon dioxide, fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of heat of 2 MJ for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that includes 50% natural gas.  Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals.

exchanges.description: Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.

flow.name: Water
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation, based on a production capacity of 50,000 t per year and a plant life time of 50 years, therefore an amount of 4X10-10 units per kg of produced chemical  is aded to the unit process of the respective chemical. The amount is accounted for each production step. This might be an overestimation in some multistep syntheses.

flow.name: Formaldehyde
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/surface water

exchanges.description: Estimation, based on the assumption that 0.2% of volatile input materials is emitted to air occurring from the purge vent, the destillation vent and fugitive emission sources.

flow.name: Acetaldehyde
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description: Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of heat of 2 MJ for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that inlcudes 12% steam from external energy sources.  Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals.

flow.name: Butanol
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/high population density

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Stoichiometric calculation, assuming an efficiency of 100%.

Further references:

Shimizu et al. 2000. Shinkichi Shimizu, Nanao Watanabe, Toshiaki Kataoka, Takayuki Shoji, Nobuyuki Abe, Sinji Morishita, Hisao Ichimura: Pyridine and Pyridine Derivatives. exchanges.description:
Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of electricity of 0,333 kW for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that inlcudes 38% electricity.  Additionally, reaction steps are approximated with energy consumption data, assuming that inventory flows can be estimated using process data for basic operation steps, available for specific organic chemicals.
